channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report X-2024021366
item.description:
Report X-2024021366

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: VANDALIA
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: A box was unloaded from a trailer. The box was wet and had hazardous material indicators on packaging. Package handler inform management who then informed QA. box was picked up with gloves and put in hazard material drum. Contents were then inspected and it was discovered one of the jugs had been leaking from its lid. DescribePack: 1 of the jugs had a loose cap. Threads may be damaged as tightening the lid as much as possible still does not stop a small leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Box was quickly placed in a hazardous material bucket and moved away from workers.

item.title: Report E-2024030002
item.description:
Report E-2024030002

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-04T15:11:50+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-26
  • City: HEATH
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 26, 2024, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3267 was damaged in transit and released approximately ten (10) gallons of product to the pallet, trailer, and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE crews deployed a neutralizing solution to the impacted areas until a neutral pH was confirmed. Granular absorbents were deployed and worked in with hand tools. The undamaged cargo was repalletized for transport with the driver back to the Wilmington, OH terminal. The damaged drum was collected and containerized into one (1) 85-gallon overpack drum, and all UN3267-impacted material was collected and containerized into one (1) additional 55-gallon drum. All generated waste was staged on-site.

item.title: Report X-2024021191
item.description:
Report X-2024021191

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-01T18:14:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-13
  • City: GROVE CITY
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Certified personnel were notified of a distressed package, which was pulled from the system. Leakage was contained to the box. Package was placed in a lined red tote. DescribePack: Package was discovered wet and upon inspection, the cap was found loose allowing for leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Pads were used soak up the liquid and placed in a lined red tote. Caps were tightened to stop further leaking

DescribePack: Drum was being rts. Drum was dropped from conveyor belt causing the drum to get dented and some small puncture holes to happen, allowing leakage. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Placed upside down so the puncture holes are facing up.

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat package was found on the end of trailer when unload opened the door. Hazmat box was wet. QA was immediately called about the package. Package was placed in a hazmat drum by QA and inspected. It was found 1 of the 4 jerricans had a loose lid and had leaked contents. DescribePack: Lid on the 1 gallon jerrican was loose. Leaking was a very slow drip. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Hazmat package was placed in hazmat drum and lid was attempted to be screwed back on.

item.title: Report E-2024020494
item.description:
Report E-2024020494

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-28T18:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-06
  • City: MANSFIELD
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Enviroserve was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractor’s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted a 5ft-by-10ft area of the trailer floor and estimated that eighteen (18) ounces of material was released due to forklift damaging one (1) 55-gallon metal drum. Enviroserve personnel deployed absorbent pads to the impacted area and gathered the spent absorbents. The damaged 55-gallon metal drum and spent absorbent pads were placed into one (1) 85-gallon metal drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
